meanings.definition: A system for transliterating Chinese characters into the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: Learning pinyin helps us read Chinese characters in English letters.
meanings.sent2: In Mandarin class, we practice writing using the pinyin system.
meanings.sent3: I tried to write my name in pinyin, but it looked like a secret code!
meanings.sent4: Pinyin is like a bridge that connects Chinese characters to the English alphabet.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made us chant pinyin sounds to remember the letters better.

meanings.definition: The official romanization system for Standard Mandarin in China.
meanings.sent1: Chinese road signs often include pinyin to help travelers.
meanings.sent2: When visiting China, it's useful to know how to read pinyin for directions.
meanings.sent3: I pretended to be a pinyin expert and gave my friends fake translations.
meanings.sent4: Pinyin is like a guidebook that helps you navigate the sounds of Mandarin.
meanings.sent5: The pinyin on the menu made it easier for me to order my favorite dish.

meanings.definition: The pronunciation of Chinese characters using the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: We practiced pinyin to improve our Chinese pronunciation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked us to read aloud using correct pinyin sounds.
meanings.sent3: My friend tried to speak Chinese with pinyin, but it sounded funny.
meanings.sent4: Pinyin acts as a map that shows us how to say Chinese words in English.
meanings.sent5: Listening to native speakers helped me perfect my pinyin pronunciation.
